title: Can you join a Zoom meeting anonymously? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, you cannot easily join the zoom meeting anonymously without the zoom ID or invitation ID. Also as for the doubt with the “how to have a meeting with a contact on zoom?” The answer for the question is similar to the question asked previously and also you cannot enter into the meeting without any contact link. The contacts are needed to be verified by the host gathering you for the meeting and also that you need to have the registration link through which you can make the meeting entry. There are a lot more features which are available in the zoom launcher for the free users and also for the premium users. You need to pay a certain level of amount to enjoy the premium usage.

Yes, create a fake Zoom ID then hold a meeting. It’s difficult to know why you would want to do this? Unless you’re a hacker, you can’t really crash into someone else’s meeting. Your chosen name pops up as you plug in. If you feel comfortable being the uninvited guest, then try it. Be warned, shouts of abusive language will echo at you. And you’ll quickly be ejected.

This is not possible as Zoom does not have an option where you can enter meetings without the host knowing it. However, an alternate to this can be renaming yourself, so that the host does not know your real name. However, this again depends on the host’s settings as the host has an option to not allow participants to rename themselves or perform any action.

This is entirely dependent on the hosts’ settings. If a host does not require registration, or authorization, and one is not logged in to zoom, one can join using any name one chooses. But, if one has been on a previous call, the name you used may be stored and used in a new call. You have the option to rename yourself during the call.

If you see someone in your Zoomsession who is anonymous, you can ask them to identify themselves. If they don't respond, or you don't like the answer, you can remove them from the meeting. At any point, you can also mute any participant. ... Similarly, you can lock the meeting to only those you want in the session.

No. And especially now. Zoom has changed the duration of sessions because so many people are calling family and friends and work use that you if invited to session, you are given a password and host must invite to call.
